qas.question: What branch of the USA Armed Forces is the largest?
How many uniformed services are there in the US?
What years did the American Revolutionary War span?
What date was the U.S. Army created?
What did the U.S Army replace?
What branch of the USA Armed Forces is the smallest?
How many uniformed services are there in Canada?
What years did the French Revolutionary War span?
What did the U.S. Navy replace?
When was the U.S.  Navy disbanded?

context: <a0_0>The <b5_0>United States Army<b5_0/><a0_0/> (USA) is the largest branch of the United States Armed Forces and performs land-based military operations. It is one of the <a1_0><b6_0>seven<b6_0/><a1_0/> uniformed services of the United States and is designated as the Army of the United States in the United States Constitution, Article 2, Section 2, Clause 1 and United States Code, Title 10, Subtitle B, Chapter 301, Section 3001. As the largest and senior branch of the U.S. military, the modern U.S. Army has its roots in the <b8_0>Continental Army<b8_0/>, which was formed (14 June 1775) to fight the American Revolutionary War (<a2_0><b7_0>1775–83<b7_0/><a2_0/>)—before the U.S. was established as a country. After the Revolutionary War, the Congress of the Confederation created the United States Army on <a3_0><b9_0>3 June 1784<b9_0/><a3_0/>, to replace the disbanded <a4_0>Continental Army<a4_0/>. The United States Army considers itself descended from the Continental Army, and dates its institutional inception from the origin of that armed force in 1775.
